meanings.definition: To certify or attest to the authenticity of a document by a notary public.
meanings.sent1: The notary notarised the contract to make it official.
meanings.sent2: She notarised the will to ensure its validity.
meanings.sent3: The notarised paper danced in the wind, showing its importance.
meanings.sent4: His signature notarised the agreement, sealing their deal.
meanings.sent5: The notarised stamp gleamed with authority, marking the document as genuine.

meanings.definition: To have a document officially witnessed and signed by a notary public.
meanings.sent1: They needed to notarise the deed for the property transfer.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer notarised the affidavit for legal purposes.
meanings.sent3: The notarised document winked at the camera, ready for its close-up.
meanings.sent4: Her pen notarised the paper, making it legally binding.
meanings.sent5: The notarised certificate shone brightly, proving its authenticity.
